summary: The document details a memorandum about the training and issuance of materials to an agent codenamed AMLASH/1 in Paris, France, from 17-22 August 1962. It covers the instruction in clandestine communication techniques, specifically the use of a carbon writing system and liquid developer for secret writing (S/W). Despite initial skepticism, the agent was convinced of the necessity for secure communication. The training included preparation and development of S/W messages, with the agent demonstrating aptitude and security consciousness. Materials for S/W communication were provided, along with instructions on accommodation addresses and indicators for secure correspondence.
key_findings: AMLASH/1 underwent training in S/W techniques in Paris, learning to use carbon writing and liquid developer systems.
Initially unfamiliar with clandestine communications, the agent was effectively trained over five hours.
Issued materials included carbon paper, developer pills, writing paper, pencils, a ball-point pen, and accommodation addresses in Madrid and New York.
The agent showed security consciousness and independently practiced S/W techniques.
Detailed instructions were provided for re-supply arrangements and the use of danger or control indicators for secure communication.
